duties_responsibilities.duty: Drive strategic alignment between business unit objectives and enterprise security strategy.
Foster partnerships with stakeholders and develop relationships that promote trust and increase program implementation efficiency.
Influence the delivery and priority of service features and development of new security services or products based on strategic security needs.
Support the development of risk remediation action plans and ensure the priority of security work is balanced appropriately amongst other business priorities.
Stay current with the external threat environment for emerging threats and ensure advisement to relevant stakeholders on the appropriate course of action.
Collaborate with local counsel on incident resolution and regulatory compliance matters, as applicable.
Advocate for security recommendations for third-party risk management and advance the development of the security champion program.
Develop and maintain a network of industry contacts, perform or direct research on industry trends, competitors, business and IT products, and make strategic and tactical recommendations.
Participate in program increment planning events and influence the strategic cyber risk management vision that scales to the SBU.
Define and effectively communicate key performance indicators (KPIs), key risk indicators (KRIs), and metrics with other SBU aligned BISOs and CISO.
Commit to continual learning, particularly as it relates to regulatory, technology, and cybersecurity and privacy industry trends, applying knowledge to global strategy and program improvements.
Assist in the management of security incidents and events to protect IT assets, regulated data, and the company's reputation.
Make strategic and tactical recommendations based on research on industry trends, competitors, and business and IT products.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's or Master's Degree in technical or business discipline or related experience; Master's Degree preferred.
